remarks: If ` K ` and ` M ` are relatively prime, then the GCD of ` K ` and ` M x. N ` is the GCD of ` K ` and ` N ` .  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 12-Apr-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2014.)
statement: rpmulgcd $p |- ( ( ( K e. NN /\ M e. NN /\ N e. NN ) /\ ( K gcd M ) = 1 ) -> ( K gcd ( M x. N ) ) = ( K gcd N ) ) $.
